activities:
Data Subjects
The Personal Data transferred concern the following categories of Data Subjects: 
•	current, former and prospective employees 
•	current, former and prospective clients
•	current and former partners

Purpose of the transfers
The transfer is made for the following purposes:
In respect of employees:
•	Staff administration
•	Employee remuneration and benefits
•	Work management
•	Training
•	Recruitment
•	Termination

In respect of clients:
•	Customer analysis for internal business planning and marketing
•	Sales administration and management
•	Technical support services

In respect of partners:
•	Internal business planning and marketing
•	Contract administration
•	Sales administration and management
•	Technical support services
Categories of data 
The Personal Data transferred concern the following categories of data:	 
In respect of employees:
•	Personal details
•	Passport and Visa details
•	Tax file number
•	Next of Kin
•	Employment history
•	Benefits and remuneration entitlement and receipt
•	Recruitment details
•	Training needs and training received
•	Review and appraisal
•	Termination details
•	Employee health 

In respect of clients:
•	Names, job titles, contact information
•	Transaction and payment information
•	Details of goods and services provided

In respect of partners:
•	Names, job titles, contact information
•	Details of goods and services received
•	Details of goods and services provided
•	Transaction and payment information
•	Client/Partner relationships

Recipients
The Personal Data transferred may be disclosed only to the following recipients or categories of recipients:
•	Authorised officers, employees, directors, contractors, and internal consultants of Nintex and its affiliates.  In the case of internal consultants transfer will be subject to receiving appropriate confidentiality/security undertakings.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Electronic and manually processed data relating to employees, customers, resellers, and technology partners
